Do you have skype? Check your messages.

item.source: I dont get how to declare a variable

item.title: I dont get how to declare a variable
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

HELLO!!! Please tell me what you want this variable to affect. If EACH individual player has a different value of this variable (ex. quests) put the variable in the player class AND write it in the playersave.java. If you want it to affect a certain function in the game, place it in the .java file with that function (ex. Treasure Trails). If you want it to affect the entire server, put it in the Constants.java or Config.java as a CONSTANT variable.

Read full topic

Add the switch statement below "targetSlot = Item.targetSlots[wearID];" Instead of "public boolean wearItem(int wearID, int slot) {"

Declaring the variable wouldn’t really make the code provided by that author work.

item.title: I dont get how to declare a variable
item.dc:creator: @Sessy_Pk3r Sessy Pk3r
item.description:
@Sessy_Pk3r wrote:

[quote=“wannaflyhi, post:7, topic:527945”]can someone spoon feed because i really dont get how to do it[/quote]

I’ll break it down for you as simple as I can.

There are different types of variables varying on the modifiers.
Some modifiers include:

int   //a variable that represents an integer(a number)
boolean   //used in true or false statements
string   //a line of text

The syntax for declaring any variable is as follows

What does it look like in use?

[code]boolean NoobCoder = false; //DECLARES THE VARIABLE (BEFORE THE CODE)

if(NoobCoder == false){ //IF THE VARIABLE IS SET TO MODIFIER VALUE
continueReadingThread(); //EXECUTE ACTION
}else{ //IF IT’S NOT FALSE
closeWindow(); //EXECUTE ANOTHER ACTION
color().useCrayons().colorChoice(red); //MORE ACTIONS
}
[/code]

Read full topic
